  • City: ROCK ISLAND

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Unload manager opened the trailer and was hit with the smell of the damaged haz mat. The trailer was loaded improperly and packages were thrown all over the trailer. The haz mat was unloaded and brought to the haz mat cage. The trailer was pulled off door to air out so nothing was unloaded on time. DescribePack: The lid on one of the bottles was loose and with the movement in the trailer it looks like it had ended up on their side and slowly leaked out. One side of the package was wet from the leak. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: There was no spill aside form on the box. It is was taken to the haz mat cage right away in a tote.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: ROCK ISLAND
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XQC experienced a UN1604 Ethylenediamine release from a 55-gallon poly drum due to a puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 6' x 5' area of the trailer floor due to a puncture. An acid neutralizing absorbent was deployed and worked into the impacted area. The damaged drum and cleanup debris were then containerized into a 95-gallon and 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XCH experienced a release of UN1230 Methanol DR448 C from a 55-gallon steel drum due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to a 20' x 5' area of the concrete lot and trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents and boom were deployed to clean and contain the release. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly drum. All cleanup debris was containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023060619
item.description:
Report X-2023060619

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-02
  • City: MOKENA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered at Mokena Station 610 on the 200 van line between work areas 216 and 236 by Alpimex BC, Andres Galvez, who immediately informed FedEx Ops Manager, Robert Sanner. During this time, it was discovered that two employees, Darrius Cozart and Jeremy Murray, had come in contact with the hazmat. Robert immediately instructed Darrius and Jeremy to rinse hands under water. Robert then placed damaged hazmat in bag + tote and promptly removed the package from the work area. He then communicated incident to ops admins, Emil Wisch (myself) and Keeli Palmateer. Emil & Keeli instantly moved to location to assess the incident. There was a small amount of the hazmat spilled in drops under the line/rollers between work areas 216 and 236. There were two places where the spill was more concentrated (one was roughly an area of 10" X 2" and the other roughly 14" x 2"). Emil instructed nearby managers, package handlers, BCs and drivers to stay clear of the area and left to retrieve PPE and cleanup materials while Keeli researched first aid response for Darrius and Jeremy. She echoed Robert's instructions of running contact areas under water (adding the details running under COLD water for 15 MINUTES). Darrius and Jeremy were moved to the office where Senior Manager, Nancy Morris and P&D Manager, Patryk Rojewski took over first aid. Emil returned and spread AMPHOMAG neutralizer on spill locations while Keeli observed (training). It was later discovered that the spill had actually originated in a trailer in the unload. It is unknown how the damage to the package occurred. There were no reports of any injuries to any employees who were near that trailer at the time the package was unloaded. Emil and Keeli moved to the location where the spill had originated. Emil spread AMPHOMAG neutralizer on all visible locations of the spilled hazmat while Keeli observed (training). Emil and Keeli later returned to both locations where the neutralizer was spread and collected all materials in hazmat bags and totes. There are no known complications to employees, Darrius Cozart or Jeremy Murray, proceeding the incident up to the time of this report. Both reported to work the following day with no known restrictions. DescribePack: There was a large hole/tear in the outer container of the package. Inside the package were 4 x 1 gallon plastic bottles of hazmat. Each bottle was contained in a plastic bag. One of those bottles' caps was unfastened. No damage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: 1 hour is overestimating. I believe the release was less than 30 minutes (in our facility, station 610). Response was timely and well-coordinated. Mitigation included prompt first-aid to 2 affected employees, near-instant containment of damaged package allowing no future release and neutralization of acid to prevent any further damage to people, package and facility.

  • Description: On May 26, 2023, one (1) one-gallon jug of Zep FS Foaming Liquid was punctured by a nail and released approximately six (6) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the site. HCE personnel noted that terminal personnel had deployed neutralizing absorbents and overpacked the damaged container in one (1) 85-gallon overpack. HCE deployed additional absorbents to the spill and swept them in using hand tools. All spent absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2023060015

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-11
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 11, 2023, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN3264 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 150-gallons of product to the loading dock floor, pallets, and surrounding cargo. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the site. HCE personnel deployed a neutralizing agent and granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. The crew hand pumped the remaining product to one (1) new 325-gallon tote. Cres utilized a Sawzall to dismantle the damaged 275-gallon tote. All UN3264 impacted material was containerized into eight (8) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CTCX 733705 Styrene car was found leaking from the combination housing in the Galesburg Yard. CTCX 733705 was inspected by the Mechanical Hazmat Responder and it was determined the liquid valve 4 bolt flange bolts were less than tool tight. This allowed product to be released. Mechanical tightened the liquid valve four flange bolts to mitigate the release. A BNSF Contractor was dispatched to inspect the car after repairs were made by BNSF Mechanical.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found at top/beginning of 200 line in middle of station spilling contents. Interviewed all known responders and it is unknown how package fell, dropped or was impacted. Package was seen intact and not leaking prior to incident. Manager, Matt Malloy, and QA Admin, Keeli Palmateer minimized release by placing leaking package in hazmat bag and spill tote. Matt Malloy then spread the Amphomag Universal Spill Neutralizer on spilled material. Maintenance assisted in cleanup - all cleanup materials were placed in hazmat bags and totes. DescribePack: The structure of the outer fiberboard box looked to have been broken down. There were also tears (1 x 4 inches and 1 x 2 inches) in the outer fiberboard box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Sealed in drums or double bagged anything that came in contact with the flammable liquid.

item.title: Report X-2023050710
item.description:
Report X-2023050710

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-09
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TWILIGHT RECEIVED A CALL FROM A SUPEVISOR THAT A LEAKING HAZMAT WAS ON THE IR2 BALL MAT. THE RESPONDER LEFT THE PSC TO GO TO THE SPILL FOR CLEAN UP TAKING A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. THE RESPONDER HAD ON PPE (NITRILE GLOVES, LATEX GLOVES, SILVER SHIELD LINERS, SLEEVES, APRON, GOGGLES, AND BOOTS). AT THE LOCATION OF THE SPILL A HAZMAT PACKAGE WITH A FLAMMABLE LIQUID, 3, LEAKED LIQUID ONTO A CART AND THEN THE RESPONDER TOOK A JANUARY 2021 DECISION TREE TO BEGIN CLEAN UP. USED THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET AND SOLIDIFIED THE LIQUID USING CLAY BASED ABSORBENT. THE PACKAGE WAS SEPARATED AND CONTAINERIZED INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY. DEBRIS WITH THE SOLIDIFED MATERIAL WAS THEN PLACED INSIDE A SEPARATE SPILL TRAY. IT WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP TO GET PROCESSED AND REFERED TO A WASTE DISPOSAL FOR A FULL DMP FLOW CHART. DMP PROCEDURES WERE FOLLOWED AND ONE DMP BAG WAS MADE DECON OF PPE.

item.title: Report X-2023050679
item.description:
Report X-2023050679

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-04
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SLIC 6039 TWILIGHT HAD A CORROSIVE HAZMAT, TRIFLUROACERIC ACID, LEAK ON A BALL MAT AT WEST BULK. PSC WAS CALLED BY A SUPERVISOR TO SEND A DESIGNATED RESPONDER AT 16:36. RISK OF EMPLOYEE BEING EXPOSED WERE MIDIGATED BY THE SUPERVISOR IN THAT AREA. THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED AT THE SPILL FIFTEEN MINUTES LATER WITH A FULLY STOCKED PUSHCART AND SCBA UNIT. THE RESPONDER WORE NITRILE GLOVES, LATEX GLOVES, BOOTS, APRON, GOGGLES, SLEEVES AND SILVER SHIELD LINERS. USED THE JANUARY 2021 DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET FOR CORROSIVE. PACKAGE WAS PLACED INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY AND THEN VISIBLE FUMES WERE SEEN COMING OUT OF THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER BEGAN AT THE BEGINNING OF THE DECISION TREE AND THE CONTAINMENT SHEET FOR ACTIVATION OF THE CHAIN OF COMMAND, PAGE 17. CORDONED OFF THE AREA USING CAUTION TAPE AND NOTIFIED CEC AND MANAGEMENT ACTIVATED THE CHAIN OF COMMAND. OUTSIDE RESPONDER ARRIVED AT 19:15 AND TOOK THE PACKAGE AND DEBRIS RELATED TO THE SPILL. NO DECONTAMINATION OF SCBA OR PPE IT WAS NOT USED TO CLEAN UP.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1442 ET, XPO terminal XQC contacted ERTS to report a spill that occurred on the dock in Rock Island, IL. The spill consisted of (1) 4-gallon metal can of UN1263 R-Cure 200 Primer Epoxy, which was dented at the top by a forklift blade, causing approximately 1-cup to release onto the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they were comfortable to clean up the spill with Oil Dri and PPE, but did not have a waste drum. ERTS will dispatched a contractor to drop off a 55-gallon poly drum. Once it arrived, XPO placed the waste into the drum which was then staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

  • City: MOKENA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Station 0610 Sort Manager, Kyle Beaumont, discovered the package with soiled exterior. There was no evidence of spillage at station 0610. He immediately placed package into a plastic hazardous materials bag and then into a hazardous materials tub and delivered to QA area for QA inspection. Emil Wisch sealed hazmat and placed in hazmat cage on spill containment pallet. DescribePack: Outer packaging seems to have been undamaged prior to leak from internal container. The uppermost portion of the cap of the internal container (bottle) was broken off, leaving the threaded portion of the body of the cap mostly intact. There was not additional packing material inside the outer package to cushion the internal bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed in a hazardous materials bag. The package was handled with care not to further allow additional release. No leakage occurred at this point or beyond.

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-02
  • City: MARINE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 2, 2023, at 1945 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Plainfield, Indiana regarding the release of approximately 35-gallons of VEX244-506 C Vinyl Ester Resin (Resin solution, UN1866, 3, III) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The release was reportedly due to a puncture and was contained to an 8’ x 53’ area of the trailer floor as well as a 1' x 1' area of the shoulder of the roadway. No drains or waterways were affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste debris generated was containerized in (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste drums were then transported offsite by contractors for proper disposal. E-2023050167 On May 3, 2023, at 1411 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Plainfield, Indiana regarding the release of approximately 5 gallons of VEX244-506 C Vinyl Ester Resin (Resin solution, UN1866, 3, III) from (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The release was reportedly due to a puncture and was contained to an 6’ long trail and continuing on to a 3' x 3' area of asphalt. No drains or waterways were affected by the release. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release using absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste debris generated was containerized in (1) 95-gallon metal drum which was then transported offsite by contractors for proper disposal.
